review_text:
Fist impression was very bad and it was my trip to Brussels. When we arrived, there was no lobby, no reception, no concierge... only a counter with one person and not even with a hotel uniform. This was more like rent a room rather than a 3star hotel as it is advertised. The hotel’s webpage says nothing about the renovations and Booking.com  says that construction will end by Sept 10, which was not true, not even close. The room does NOT have air conditioner so if you want to rest during your vacations this is not the place. It has a fan (not a ceiling fan) not big enough to keep the room cool and if you leave the glass door open you will listen all the noise from the street and also all the light will come inside the room. I sweated all night. Bed and pillow are not confortable. There is no an ice machine. The day we left the only elevator thy have was not working to take the luggage down. For the approx. $125 per night that I paid, or maybe paying a little more, I would have find a much better place. I did not move to another place because of cancellation fees and looking for a hotel at last moment would cost much more. I definitely don’t recommend this place. The only good things it has is the location. ,

Location

We had to order and pay for our breakfasts for the two days in advance, 15 euro per person. The breakfast was very poor value for money indeed. No choice of cereal, just corn flakes in a plastic tube. The cheese slices curled at the edges, no fruit. Just orange juice (no choice), cornflakes, roll with some ham and cheese and coffee. 15 euro!! We have stayed in Yores hotels before so know that by comparison this was VERY poor!  On the last morning, there were no cereal bowls or cereal - we had to ask for some. The stairs to bedrooms share access to the cafe WC!  The door was always open with a constant spell of urine etc emanating up the stairs. The stairs and bannisters were wobbly and insecure. Both bedrooms had curtains which did not close properly due to missing hooks. The carpets needed a good clean. Two of our party were in their early 80s. We were on the 2nd floor which they could manage okay but there was no light up the final three steps - it was broken - and though we pointed this out it was not fixed.
Paid staff were friendly but the owner was not - no welcome or enquiry as to our stay. 
The whole stay at Old Tom was a big disappointment.,

Location was central.  Bed linen and towels were clean. Cafe was nicely decorated.

The pillows were a bit strange and uncomfortable - they seemed to be made of blocks of foam. The windows had to be propped open in order to let any air in (although being directly on the street was a bit noisy to have the windows open anyway). There was dirt in the corner of the room when we arrived, but otherwise the room and bathroom were clean. The bathroom had no window or exhaust fan (and also no candle or air freshener) and plumbing is very loud if you are a light sleeper. Plumbing can be heard also when other rooms shower or use the toilet. Also, the hairdryer did not function well and the water in the shower took about a minute and a half to finally become warm. The check in staff is a bit unfriendly and the website says they speak English, Spanish, French, and Dutch. We tried English, Dutch, and Spanish but only French was actually possible. The website also says checkout is 11:00am, but it is actually 10.30, which is quite early in our experience. Unfortunately, our room was one of the rooms that did not receive a wifi signal.,

The view was wonderful and the location was excellent. Overall, this is a very, very basic room in a great location on the river for a decent price during the summer high season. Free parking within 50-100m was a nice bonus.

The main things to consider before booking this boutique hotel are the fairly strict conditions in comparison with larger city centre hotels, in particular a 30-day cancellation policy and little flexibility of the timing of your check-in, as staff is only present at breakfast and during certain hours of the afternoon to receive new guests. The premises are fully covered by CCTV. If you can live with those restrictions, and if you don't mind climbing stairs, then you will have an absolutely wonderful stay.
Perhaps a small point of improvement might be the stability of the Wifi connection in the top floor suite, but the network connectivity in the common area was excellent.,

Loved the smell of freshly baked croissants every morning, as well as the overall help-yourself-at-any-time attitude of this boutique hotel, which does indeed make it an "all in one" experience. Coming home from work, you can make yourself a coffee or choose from a range of exquisite teas, and there will be some cookies and cake to accompany your beverage, which you enjoy in a beautiful salon with art on the walls and glossy magazines.
A special thanks to staff, who noticed within two minutes of my departure that I had forgotten my laptop in the room and took the trouble of reaching me on mobile to ensure I wouldn't leave without it. A personal touch that exemplifies the bliss of staying in a small boutique hotel with caring hosts.

Despite initially looking at this hotel for me trip, I went with the Radisson due to brand loyalty, however when informed of the renovation works I changed my booking to this hotel.
 Had to pay a 77 Euro upgrade because my room wasn't ready on arrival despite contacting them ahead. Got a Junior Suite which was spacious with a courtyard view, bedroom separate from bathroom and a mini hallway area,
Although it was very disappointing that a second bed wasn't placed in a lounge area as we were staying with my son, we had to share the bedroom with him, and in my opinion and experience in a suite their should be two sleeping areas. I also thought the bed whilst quite comfortable were tiny, my wife and I shared a supposed double bed and we barely fit it.
Also because staying with my son, it would have been nice to take advantage of room service, but the price was ludicrous, starting at 6 Euro for a espresso, so this was completely prohibitive, also be aware the hotel lists spa and fitness centre, whilst a basic gym is available the Spa actually doesnt belong to the hotel and you have to pay a 25 Euro surcharge per day to access it.,

Location seems ok, only a 10 minute Uber from the centre and 6-10 minute Uber from Brussels- Midi International.
Very grand looking and gives the impression of a grand 5 star hotel.

- Even though we were the only ones using our shower (thus private), it was in the ground floor (we were in the attic) which made our staying uncomfortable since we had a small kid. 
- Our private bathroom was also in the ground floor. Another bathroom existed in the first floor (below our bedroom) but it was shared.
- The ladder leading out of bedroom (in the attic) was steep and not very convenient for a small toddler and a pregnant woman (like I am). 
- The "seaview" characterization is theoretically true but in practice it's just a small portion of sea viewable from a small window in the attic. 
- Wifi was not strong in the attic where we spent most of our time, when staying in the house. If Wifi is necessary for you, you have to go to the ground floor/public space.,

- Very pleasant and welcoming hosts. 
- Free parking.
- Good common facilities (spacious kitchen and breakfast room and nice/calm terrace).
- Proximity to the sea, only 3 minutes walking distance. 
- Breakfast was good (fried egg, ham/cheese/bread, salmon tranches, coffee & juice, cereals, milk and pastries).
- Even though we didn't use them, there were some nice amenities like the shauna and the jacuzzi. The host was kind enough to borrow us a bike for free.

Absolutely nothing
As mentioned by so many guests earlier, (even though we didn’t have an issue)the only disadvantage is that there are no lifts as it’s a typical Belgian style house , so people who have difficulty to climb stairs should think twice
,

I would write a novel on what we liked if you want!
Catherine is a lovely host who has it all.
Right from welcoming to planning our best spots in Brugges ( she taught us to pronounce it as BBrrrrugheee)
Spotlessly clean rooms and you have the lower floors with a dining and living space (not to forget the garden) done in a classical style.
Nice old music playing from Beatles to Bob
Map with a great explanation of what to and what not to do in the short time we had
Good suggestions for chocolate places, restaurants
This place knows what they are doing 
They are into real hospitality which has been lost along by so many hosts.
She was like a Mother hen taking care of our every single need to the extend that she even booked us a taxi to the train early in the morning 
This has made us thinking already of going back to Brugges again
Breakfast- homely, top quality and enough quantity.
24x7 free coffee machine/tea/chocolates 
Lovely beds
Large and ulterior clean toilets
and the list goes on and on and on
We recommend this and would rate it if we could give a double thumbs up

This hotel is situated in North Brussels, and I was concerned when I walked from the train station to the hotel and passed row after row of sex shops with girls in the windows selling their 'services'. There were lots of dubious looking groups of men hanging around on the street which made me feel uncomfortable walking to and from the hotel.
The room was basic - which is to be expected with a 2 star, but there was a smear of what can only be described as human excrement on the wall, the shower leaked all over the floor as there was a gaping hole in the bottom of the base, we did not have any towels provided on the first night, and the view from our window was an adjacent roof ledge from the building next door which was scattered with empty vodka bottles, nitrous oxide canisters and spoons which I will leave to the imagination the use.
Our first night was interrupted by the fact that the room next door decided to throw a room party with loud blaring rap music and shouting/singing which despite trying to ring reception (From our mobile as the room phone didn't work) went on until 5am, with our calls to reception going unactioned. 
I get that this hotel is cheap in comparison to others, however it is still expensive for the stay we received, and next time I would pay the extra to stay somewhere nicer.

NOTHING,

GREAT !!
The Staff were more than great And Helpful we were there during ‘la Tour de France 2019’ and the roads leading to the hotel were closed the hotel sent us one of the employees ‘Alban’ to guide us through the crazy traffic he walked more than half an hour to reach us and another 1 hour in the car trying to figure out the quicker and less busier road to the hotel.
When we reach the hotel the Concierge Team welcomed us warmly with dozens of suggestions on how to spend the next 3 days in Brussels Specially Haluk et Jean in numerous instances they literally went out of the hotel with us to show how to reach a restaurant / Attraction - to my surprise the Concierge Team consist 6 personnel each specialized in a special area... and by the way they were extending the same service to all hotel Guests with the same unprecedented positive attitude at any time of the day.
With the hundreds of hotels that I have stayed with  during my travels I can easily say that I have never experienced a more professional concierge service like the one I have received from The Concierge Team at Amigo Rocco Forte.
In a nutshell. Great Location, Magnificent Concierge Team , Super clean Room and First Class Service from Doorman, Concierge , housekeeping till the Manager of the Hotel who was in the lobby most of the time.
Well Done Rocco Fort Team

The owner of the hotel was rude and the overall cleanliness of the room we were allocated was disgusting. The carpet was stained, the window was broken and taped up and the dust had been there for ages. The TV didn't work and the room was remotely like anything I had seen when looking for accommodation, we requested a different room he said he didn't have any. He informed me I had booked a double and that was what he gave me. He was then told that I had asked for double or a twin but certainly not a dirty room.  He said there was nothing he could do, he didn't have rooms like those advertised that was just booking.com making things up to get more people in. He eventually moved us to one of those rooms but it was still dirty with mould inside the cabinet in the bathroom and towels you could shoot peas through.  There were glass rings on the furniture which was covered in dust and the state of the radiators was sickening. I took a video or the first room and a couple of photos of the second room. We lived out of our suitcases for the 4 days & we were there on our own there were no other guests.
I wouldn't recommend this dirty hotel run by a very rude owner/manager to anyone!,

the only good thing to say about this hotel was the location.

The room was outdated and a bit rusted but didn’t affect my stay it simply doesn’t give you the feeling of hotel.The curtains was falling from the rods was hard to make it dark in the room at night. I wast able to increase to control the heat it was locket at a max I wanted it a little warmer because of my sinus. The washroom was ok but very old you can tell it is rusted need to be updated. There was a bit dust here and there and wear and tear on the walls and window. But those are really only details that some people that worked in the industry like myself would notice. My partner liked the room said was comfortable and clean.
We only spent a night on during holidays.I would say because of the location and because the bed seemed very clean and felt comfortable I think it is worthwhile. No fridge,No microwave,really thin pillow (didn’t bother asking for other type,maybe they had options).,

The location was excellent,the staff was friendly and welcoming. Check in was fast and efficient. The room had high ceilings made it feel very big. The room and bed was clean and comfortable. Bed had a decent size. It had a desk ,3-4 chairs,a Safe and some coffee,extra blanket, towels and some toiletries. No elevator.

I had the room out in the carpark and it was really cold. There was a gap under the door that wasn't covered by the curtains and all the cold air and noise was slipping in through there. The heater was working as per thermostat settings but since the bunk bed was closed towards the heater, and the gap was right near the bed.. it wasn't enough. Also, due to the huge interesting bunk bed, there was no space in the room.
The water from the bath tap was hot but wouldn't come hotter to make a decent bath. By the time the bath filled the water had cooled due to not being hot enough. Was okay for a shower though, but we were already really cold and needed to warm up and the bedroom wasn't helping us either.. unfortunately whoever designed this room didn't think the space properly because there was so much space down in the bathroom and nice and warm that I'd had rather slept in there than in the cold and tight bunk bed room above.,

The bedroom had an interesting design.. on 2 levels.. with a huge bunk bed as you walk in and the bathroom on the ground level, right under the bed. One can play with the light in the bathroom and makes it even more interesting. 
Hotel was close to the market and the train station too.

The apartment has a very nice potential, but it lacks the "final touch". Some things were not very clean (the floor in some rooms, or the dish washer), the switch for the bed lamp was broken and the electrical wires were visible, so in the dark you could touch them by mistake, the light in the bedroom and the light from the front door were broken and other small things like this.
I did not call the owners for these because those weren't things that bothered me that much.,

The apartment was is located in a very nice and quite place. It is very close to the important places to visit. The welcome was nice, they waited for us with the keys and gave us a short introduction. The apartment is large, with big rooms, it has all the utilities that you would need (kitchen with everything you need). 
If you do not want to cook, you have a lot of coffee shops and restaurants nearby. They do close pretty early, but if you make your program just right you have a nice selection of all types of food. There are also a lot of stores around.
The door to the building closes at around 21 o'clock, but you have keys for all the doors so you can return at any time you desire.
I would definitely stay here again.

BEWARE! The pictures look ok, but it is a cheap and unfinished renovation. Arrived to a construction site: electrical cables hanging out of walls; antenna cables coming in and out of windows; dead lock in apartment 3 feel apart in our hands (thank goodness we had not yet locked it!); hot water not on in apartment 3; shower drain not connected properly in apartment 2. 
Safety and security is terrible. The door from the street to the building is broken therefore people from the street and nearby night club can enter the common stairwell (and do, at all hours of the night). 
The music and crowd from the night club close by makes sleep impossible. The sensor lights within the apartment come on and off all night without reason. 
It is non-smoking accommodation; however the smoke smells from the restaurant and apartment below enter via the bathroom pipes and permeate the apartments above (particularly apartment 2). People in our group woke up feeling ill from this - we had asthmatic children in our group - even the non-asthmatics were affected by the sickly odour. 
This was our worst Booking.com experience. We all decided it was not worth compromising safety, security and health staying the second night so we checked out first thing the next morning and found alternative accommodation. 
What a disgrace that this standard of accommodation is acceptable on booking.com.

Location and smell.
The property is right next door to Antwerp Tower which has a lot of work being done on it and they start work around 6am in the morning (not bank holidays and Sundays but they are working early on Saturday morning). 
On arrival, the apartment didn't have a particularly nice smell. This got worse over the stay and it was coming from the drain in the shower. There is no door between the bathroom and the bedroom so it was not that pleasant to sleep in. We bought some gel to put down the drain and aired the room but could not get rid of the smell. We reported it after our first night but it was not sorted despite being told it was being investigated.
We also lost power and after calling the property company, we were requested to go down to the basement to reset it (the fuse box was fine). The property is shared with a restaurant downstairs and luckily we met an employee as we called the lift and they very kindly sorted the power issue for us.,

Location. This property could be rated a lot higher. It has a wonderful central location right on the edge of Antwerp Old Town. We were staying in the top floor penthouse and it has fantastic views out over Antwerp skyline.However, at the moment, it's location is also it's downfall.

Only minor things, like that there was a motion-sensor light installed at the entrance to the room so it came on if we got up in the night (like, to use the bathroom).  There was a door between the bedroom and this entry area where the motion-sensor light was, so it was not the end of the world.  We would have LOVED it if the room had had a better table for enjoying the wonderful breakfast.  We only had the desk and its one chair, which kind of brought our breakfast enjoyment down a bit (the pandemic rules require that guests eat only in their rooms).  The room was very comfortable, there were hooks in the bathroom and the tilework was all nice and clean, so no real complaints.,

Great small hotel in a suite of very old buildings.  Unique, wonderful architecture, winding hallways and staircases that led to our gigantic family room with a view over a courtyard to fascinating rooflines and a tower!  The hotel was just off the Grand Market, so it had a great location.  There was a city parking garage nearby, which worked for us since we drove.  The staff was absolutely WONDERFUL, very welcoming and accommodating.  The beds and bedding were wonderful, the bathroom was modern and very comfortable.  The breakfast provided was wonderful.  We loved it and will absolutely stay here again.

No Breakfast in the Morning. Only available few days and breakfast is very limited. The Hotel needs a lot of maintenance and facilities should be upgraded and modernized. The room was a bit worn out and not clean. Beds need to be improved or replaced for comfortable sleeping. The lights in the room need to be brighter and there should be more lights in the room. very difficult for reading or browsing with Dim lights in the room. 
The bathrooms are old-fashioned. The shower in the bathroom was broken and no hair-dryer available. Even the Door is broken and is difficult to lock it sometimes. The TV was not working at all in my room.
The Internet was slow and it needs an upgrade so that you can connect to Wi-FI with just a password valid for all devices.
Now to connect to Wi-FI I had to use a separate Username and Password for each device and it is valid only for 2 days.
The stairways are very narrow and bad considering the safety aspect in case of fire. I had a lot of difficulty in moving my luggage to the room via the very narrow staircase.
Considering all these, I would say it is not worth for the price of 70 Euros per night..,

The Location is close to the Train and metro station. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. The hotel staff is helpful.

Heavy use of conditioner on a bed linens - not all people like strong smells in the bed before sleep. Pillow was too dense and high for my taste - would be great to have a selection as in the room there are extra pillows anyway. A blanket is to warm for me, but I have this issue almost everywhere - growing up behind a polar circuit doesn't help me in this case. Bed cover is that half-synthetic thing with a rubber around mattress, doesn't breath really well, but people there are very used to them, so you'll see them a lot. Room is right under the roof and it could be quite hot inside on a sunny days and small windows won't allow to move this hot air out fast. Overall it all may look small to you and you won't even notice, I believe I've just spoiled myself sleeping on fresh chill air in all-natural bedroom at home, that is why I was too shy to tell Els and Tom all that personally.,

Exceptional breakfast, nice owners, perfect location to work in Bornem. Fast WiFi (~20 Mbps) by local standards, although signal strength could be improved. Basically you stay in a quiet beautiful place with a fresh air and nice accessibility by car, and Tom and Els will do their best to make your stay perfect.

- the fact the part of the garden we were allowed to use was not really private (it was just beside the parking lot)
- the bigger garden (the one with the view) was not open to us as guests as the robot mower was cutting the grass (we were told) -> we were surprised to see the already very short grass needed to be cut extra short 24/7
- the doors to the bathroom and bedroom didn't close (1 couldn't be closed, the other only when pushed real hard and with lots of noise) which woke our 1 yar old daughter up
- the rooms were quite chilly, even in warm weather (due to the thick walls) + due to the thick walls also quite dark
- the house isn't fit for young children: the plates and other delicate stuff were placed in an open cabinet so it was easy for our baby to grasp and break things -> we had to put everything higher so she couldn't reach all of these things & there was no high chair for us to use,

+ lots of utensils ready for use in the kitchen 
+ spacious house
+ the garden chairs we were able to use 
+ village was really quiet
+ great shower
+ tasty bottle of wine given to us by the host upon arrival 
+ warm welcome by the host

Hard Pillows, mattress protector made you sweaty. Church bell rung every half hour even through the night !  someone was smoking in another room and it stunk our room out too. Had to open the massive window/ fire escape to get some fresh air even tho it was cold outside and plugged the door seal with toilet tissue so it didnt waft in anymore. One staff member was very helpful but another had no idea...english was poor. The car park you could pay 6 euro a night for but staff member had no idea how to work the card ? then we found out you can park in the square for free between 6.30pm and 9am so didnt need to pay for the car park. Breakfast was minimal for 6 euros each. You sat eating it while people played on the slot machines.... smoking !!!! ....had to walk up 3 flights of stairs to our room no lift. Room was okay but very very basic... It had no atmosphere.... there was a pic on the wall of a man and woman .... embracing ! ? it was a bit um...... odd !,

It was warm and clean. Tv ( never turned it on tho ), shower ok not great, shower gel and soap provided. Towels ok. Bed linen ok. FREE wi Fi whoooo and it worked a treat.

Everything would have been fine if the check-in agent/staff had been more informative. The hotel had beverages in the check-in area, so after traveling for over 2 1/2 hours, a couple of us took water and crémant. We didn't ask, but as there were glasses in a bowl, we thought it was for the guests. While waiting for everyone to comedown, one of my friends took another glass of crémant. The check-in lady got really mean and angry with her saying, "it was a welcome drink and that she'd already had a drink." There wasn't a sign posted ANYWHERE to indicate that and further more, she never mentioned or offered it to us at check in. We asked if we could have the wifi code and in her rude manner, she pointed out that it was on the card key. After shopping we returned to the hotel and one of my friends happened to read the back of the card key holder and saw that we could get a 10% discount on shopping at the Maasmechelen Village. The check-in agent knew that we were going shopping, but fail to tell us about this great deal. I will say that the check-in agent at check out was much nicer and seemed sympathetic to our problems with her colleague and would mention it to her.,

The location and room!

Carpets in general are always outdated and unhygenic, but this one was covered in unknown stains, all across the room. Reading other people's reviews I realised I was not the only one encountering this. I have never seen something like this in Holland. This is unacceptable for a (4-star) hotel. (see photo)
While walking around outside its easy to forget that you're actually in Europe; the hotel is close to a train station; at night there are a lot of drug addicts, homeless and gipsies on the streets, sleeping outside or talking to you if you walk by. They come in big numbers. If you travel by car, especially one having a ''foreign'' license plate, it is highly advised to park it in the hotel garage. This costs you €25. Group of men hang around the parked cars outside, I witnessed one urinating against one. I personally wouldn't go out alone at night as a woman or with children. Be aware of pickpockets too.,

Rooms were very quiet, unlike many others hotels in Brussels. Reception staff spoke Dutch like they're supposed to.
Overall, I've learnt that booking a hotel is always quite a gamble in Belgium, even at 4-5 star hotels, the quality standard is lower. However this one was decent enough.

This time the problem came unexpectedly,
1) Some guy could not checked-in due to his payment fail. He had received the email that his payment went wrong but room was still reserved for him. BUT NO ROOM WAS RESERVED, that really awful as the hotel had not took into consideration his own emails. 
I had the same case several days ago with my payment try was declined. I received the email: 'your payment went wrong but the room was still reserved for you'. If I didn't pay that time, I would have missed my booking as well. It would be a disaster weekend
2) The receptionist declined 'late check-out' service for my friends stayed the same hotel, saying they were overbooked. No info about late check-out was about no-possibility to add 'late check-out' option when  you are checking-in
3) Room 403 - mini-bar refrigirator is not cooling and remained hot. That made me throw away my salat. It was really unpleasant situation
Room 103 - the sink was blocked and water did not go away easily,

It was not the first time I stayed there, thus I knew what to expect.
My previous experience with the hotel went smooth and without any issues.
The room was good and matched what I saw in photoalbum. 
+ Thet provide late check-out which was necessary in my case

My biggest gripe was the WiFi. It doesn’t work in the rooms as advertised. When i spoke to staff they appeared to be looking in to it but really did nothing about it, instead advising us to use reception’s WiFi. There was no modem on 3rd floor and the one of 4th floor had no power so I feel that it has been the case for a while. 
One of the staff made me feel that my complaint was not warranted as WiFi was ‘free therefore I should be grateful’ and it was not my right to complain given they have an alternative. 
The bathroom screen was also broken so water ran all over bathroom floor and flooded the main room, under the bed and so on. Make sure you place towels on the floor to prevent this. 
Rooms don’t have air con so if you are staying in the peak of summer, ask for corner room or you may be sleeping with your door open which we saw a few people do. 
Overall I wouldn’t stay there again. ,

Hotel is in a fantastic location. The metro is at the front and you are 5 min walk from centre, with cafes and restaurants literally at your doorstep. Room was clean, had a great view and the one we had was quite large.

Shared bathroom,

This B&B is clearly a labour of love. Sharon is a top-notch host, and one of the sweetest, most caring and sincere owners of a B&B we have met. The exceptionally well maintained and attention is paid to every detail for your experience.   The location, about an 8 min cycle into historical Diest is perfect if you are travelling by bike. There is also a great little grocery store a few minutes walk away if you need any provisions. Water, tea, coffee, milk (for your tea or coffee) and beer are all available for you in the kitchen and Sharon asks you to make yourself at home. There were even chocolates on the bed when we arrived in our room.  The only downside is that there is a shared bathroom, not an issue during our visit since we were the only guests that night but not something we noticed when we booked and something that we usually avoid. Sharon has gone to efforts to make this work with robes in each room for guests transiting to and from the facilities, an ‘in use or available’ sign on the door and space for storage of toiletries etc assigned for each room in the bathroom.
Breakfast was excellent with the same attention paid to detail as in all other aspects of our stay.

Some of the staff was very polite, but some of the staff was unpolite, especially when appeareantly it got busy and I wanted to check out. I asked for the corporate invoice and said that I will write the requisites, then person servicing the checkout said that I am asking too many questions at the time and he can't answer all of them, so I need to wait. Even though I was the only person he was talking to and I didn't ask any questions, I just wanted an invoice. Then he said that appearantly someone had already paid for the rooms. This probably meant that I couldn't paid for the rooms. When I said, that I paid for the rooms through booking.com, he become more polite, but still was very bothered by the fact that we need to leave 4 bags and will pick them up later on. 
Then we also tried to used the interactive service in the room and order drinks which offered 2 options to recieve the drink - ASAP or later. We have chosen ASAP, but half an hour later still without the drinks, we went to the reception and they didn't notice that we have ordered the drink. So do not use the application if you want drinks asap.,

Nice location, good breakfast, comfortable room with complimentary water.

Rooms too small, the pool is very cold (If you have a pool, don't you want your visitors to use it? After 20 minutes we had to leave because of the cold water).
For sure I can tell that the room was not cleaned daily, only arranged the beds and changed the towels.
Soap and Shampoo (Not separate) is located In a device near the sink and bathtub. I expect 4 star hotel to have a higher level Toiletries. This issue was not too important for us, I just mention it for the next guests.
Air condition was a little noisy when you moved it from Fan level "1" to "2".
Parking is 16 Euro per day and not under the hotel. 2 minutes walk so first you need to take your luggage and move it from the car to the lobby and, then, park your car.,

It is good hotel with very good breakfast and a indoor pool (Look also at the "didn't like") located at the center of Hasselt. The service is very good, reception staff helped us with any questions or requests even when we arrived late. Rooms are bit small but OK. Very quiet. Air conditioned.
Price is fair.
For 2-3 days of staying I would recommend this hotel.

There seemed to be a lot of confusion in the dining room. The table in the restaurant they first gave us was not suitable for our dog (we did not want it in the middle of a high foot traffic area). When we relayed that, the staff said the dog was not allowed and we would have to sit in the bar. We explained that we had seen a dog earlier in the day sitting in the restaurant. We were seated in the bar and two other dogs showed up and they were seated in the bar area. The third dog showed up and they were seated in the dining room. The staff doesn't seem to know their own rules. We waited for a long period of time for our food and then told they were out of one item we ordered. So we ordered something else. A few minutes later, the original order arrived! Neither a big worry, but we would like to be treated like everyone else, whether our dog is with us or not. Many doors in the rooms needed to be fixed. You had to slam the doors shut which I am sure was annoying to other guests.,

the breakfast was very good- great selections. We ate in the restaurant one evening and the food was very good although there was much conconfusion.

While it’s a dog-friendly apartment, the immediate area isn’t good for walking dogs. That isn’t the owner’s fault, of course, it’s just how it is. The room was nice and had everything we needed, but the double bed didn’t have a proper frame so was on the floor. That may not be a problem for many people, but for me it was because I have very bad knees and can’t get up easily from the floor. Also, the bathroom was very nice but has a metal floor (I assume so that it’s easy to clean), which was VERY cold in the winter. However, we did mention this as a suggestion on Seb’s suggestion board so hopefully that won’t be an issue soon. ,

It was very close to the motorway, and quite close to Namur centre. We liked that they allow dogs and that they have all of the facilities you’d need (beds (one double, one single), table and chairs, kitchen area including sink, microwave and kettle) were all in one room, with a separate en-suite bathroom. It was great that we could both check in and check out late, and Seb is really friendly

No cooking oil, which is a very cheap fix but a critical one indeed.  This can be a bit of a hinderance if one's coming in late at night.  The local Butcher is open on Sundays, fortunately, and I picked up a steak, various cold cuts and Olives, Antipasto, etc.   Got a bit stuck when unable to cook due to no oil/butter. The owner/hoast brought the butter promptly but since she only speaks French (*very* little English), communication was difficult. On day 2, I used Google translate which was a lot better to communicate.   ANOTHER issue is the funky heater/Fireplace which burns pellets.  The instructions are non-existent and the explanation by the owner is in French.   What she needs to do is create ENGLISH instructions for the fireplace/heater.  Putting it on/off a few times results in heater damage (which is what happened) and the owner gave me a temporary electric heater.  That worked but was not half as charming!!,

Very nice ambience in the Chalet and good views of the surrounding forest.   Fully stocked kitchen (utensils, forks, knives, plates, etc. etc.) except that there was no cooking oil, so one was a bit stuck too cook stuff. Though the owner promptly brought butter as a substitute!

Hotel was under renovation and was actually closed but we were not made aware of this.
We had booked breakfast but bar floor was being revarnished so bar and breakfast were not available but we were not made aware of this.  We were not charged for breakfast but were just told abruptly that breakfast was not available.
Television did not work and when we complained we were told that no televisions in the building were working.
Noisy work on the renovation went on until 10 to 11 at night.
Unusual room in that whoever was having a shower was visible to the other occupants, not so bad if just your partner but not really suitable when your daughter was in the room.
Not to do with the hotel itself but walking around in the evening was disconcerting given the number of families sleeping out on the streets between hotel and Grand Place and them arguing with each other as to who should be begging off you.
Hope the hotel will be renovated sympathetically, it just would have been good to know what state it was in at the time of our visit that should not have taken place, who was at fault? Hotel or Booking, don't know. Hotel said they told booking so would have expected a message from Booking assistant.,

Nearby parking was close and safe.
Reasonably situated.

It was cold for me. Additional blanket is a must.  There is no such in the room, but it should be. The air condition was strange. Although working all night on Heat mode at 30 degrees, the room remained cold. They definitely need to change the air conditioning brand or type. At home for just 10 minutes I get sauna hot with 15 years old Panasonic inverter.
The water in the shower  was warm (not enough for me) , but not hot. I would've appreciated if there was a hot water so I can define how warm to be and to be able to take a hot shower when outside is 3 degrees and we spent all day long out. ,

The location is  just perfect. 5 minutes Antwerp Central Station and 15 minutes from the center (Grand place).
Late check-in, which is very handy. 
Very polite, kind and friendly staff. 
Very comfortable bed with nice pillows and good goose filling duvets which we loved. 
It was quiet and with almost no noise. I asked for  a room looking to the inner yard with no street view (when booking) so my request was fulfilled. It is perfect for a short period. Also very affordable prices. As overall is great according location, price and comfort.

The only downsides were that a few of the reception staff were not so friendly as Suhail, and we would have appreciated a bathmat in the bathroom. Nevertheless we would highly recommend a stay in this hotel.,

We enjoyed our stay at the  Century Hotel from the 12th to 18th February.  On arrival we received a very friendly welcome from Suhail. He explained that since we were early, he would check if a room was ready and asked if we would mind waiting for 5 – 10 mins. After a very short time he was able to give us a key card and told us that we would staying at the 9th floor where they had just fitted new showers and mattresses. The room was clean and tidy and the beds were very comfortable.
The breakfast was particularly  good for a budget hotel:  good choice of hot breakfast items, healthy options, and nice Flemish breakfast items and plenty of fresh fruit.
A little research shows that the hotel was built in the 1920s for the Antwerp World Exhibition in 1930. On the first floor there’s a long nice breakfast room overlooking the iconic central station.
The hotel’s position in very central to the tourist and shopping attractions that Antwerp has to offer. The staff at breakfast and room cleaning were very attentive and friendly.

I regret to have noticed that the tables were not cleaned well (with the hands only) nor desinfected for the next customers.
Only one young boy had to arrange everything alone for breakfast, some moments really to crowdy and busy, he should have assistance by a second person all the time. He was not able to follow-up in time what was needed or refilled constantly.,

Sufficient choice at breakfast. Very friendly cleaning personnal.
Most staff being correct, one male member nevertheless found it important to express his personal opinion that I was not allowed to read my newspaper for some moments in the facilities downstairs while it was even empty, using the very weak excuse that this was meant to be a restaurant. I wonder who will come eat anyway, where the Belgian government has meanwhile decided to close completely for one month all horeca facilities! Anyway, I have never been prohibited to read whatever in the lobby or what so one, I am a client so what? Onlly allowed to sit in the room???
Adding as well that 2 of the 3 evenings, there was a blackout of the electricity system, so at least one hour no television and no light in the rooms. But you can not read downstairs ....???
Stay a little bit reasonable please.

When we arrived we were shocked that they were still working around the houses. This was nowhere mentioned and we came to have some peace and quiet. We couldn’t sleep in because of the construction noises, we got a beer to compensate that but that doesn’t compensate our sleep. When we arrived the room was dusty, seems like it wasn’t cleaned for a while. We got dish washer tablets but we didn’t have a dishwasher. No soap to do hand dishes. There was a lot of light coming through the door which was very annoying. We couldn’t turn of the lights outside of our own door. When we wanted to shower we had ice cold water, we had to turn on the boiler ourselves. There was enough space to hang a TV to watch from bed, but there wasn’t one. The bathroom was without a door and the lights were terrible. We also had a huge stain on our bed sheets. Seems like the list is endless because it was! And oh, its a 20-25 minute walk to the beach, its not less than 1 km as advertised, it’s 100% more. ,

Parking was free and close to the building. We could check in contact free.

We travelled for my partner's anniversary: I booked a superior room and I wrote to the hotel to double-check that we have a nice room. However, the room we got looked a bit basic and had no bathtub, which is challenging with a young child. The furniture was quite shabby and we had two extra beds that we didn't need. I would have preferred if they wouldn't call this room 'superior', but rather a 'room with a view' and paid more attention to clients' requests especially if someone comes for a special occasion. In general I found other reviews suggesting that the food is overpriced and rooms in the castle quite basic to be accurate. Nevertheless, the location makes these things not too important if you want a relaxing long weekend in a family-friendly place.,

The surroundings are gorgeous and it's an excellent place to stay with kids. Playgrounds, games and activities are also very helpful if you travel with children. Staff was very friendly and we had a nice view from our room. Baby cot was available for free. They made an effort to make some food availble to eat in the rooms due to Covid measures and a small shop with free coffee and snacks to buy. A kettle in the room was also very helpful.

the hotel was on construction, we didnt know about it. if i knew i wouldnt book it, cos i was with my little son, i dont like he breathes the dusty air in the hotel. the staff seemed very unexperienced. one time she called for taxi, and she didnt inform us about how long the taxi will come, we were outside waiting, and after 15 minutes i went back to reception to ask, and she called the taxi, it took him another 10 minutes to arrive. 
during breakfast, there was one lady looking after everyone. we had to wait to be served, i think after 20 minutes she came over to take our order. they dont have open buffet which wasnt convenient. the options were very limited, and not the best quality. 
there were workers on our floor all time, as the construction was going on during the day. they had their industrial cleaning tools and machines on the hall way just left like that. 
so the money i paid was definitely way too much to our experience.
yes, room was nice and spacious. thats the only part i enjoyed.,

the location is really good. within a few minutes you are on the main shopping street, which is the centre of the city.

staff is not enough service oriented and too slow. they are not striving for excellence. we had ants in the room. they came to check it. they would send somebody afterwards. after half an hour waiting we called reception and the receptionist came herself to offer us another room. same type. 
afterwards we went to the spa, it was dirty(20:30) and the sauna was not hot. we called reception and they said they could not change it while there were at least still 20 people in the Spa. At 20:30 temperature starts already going down while it should close at 23:00. 
We paid a lot of money (266€ for one night - basic room). this is not the quality you expect for a 266€/night hotel.  the food in the restaurant is also not top. They make mistakes with tables, they forget a part of our order even. 
Don't take the desserts, its a trap and too low quality for this kind of hotel. nearly not eatable.  (paris-brest or chocomousse).,

nice environment, nice setting but service level is not according to the standard of the hotel. at first sight, service is good, but the finishing is bad, they are not accurate/precise. they forget things and are slow.

Not a problem for us but if you can't manage stairs the main bedroom is 3 floors up and you may have difficulty if you have large suitcases. It would have been nice to have a washing machine and dryer. If you are short you may find it hard to reach some of the dishes on the shelves.,

A beautiful place to stay. Easy to access with the lock box to enter the house when we arrived as that was a lot easier for us than trying to agree on times as we were travelling and had no mobile phone access in Belgium.  Great not having to carry keys. Lots of room with the bedrooms on 3 floors and 2 bathrooms. Nice setting with the garden, lovely decor and easy walk into town with the car parked close by.  We were travelling with our adult children. Plenty of space for everyone to relax. Everything you needed in the kitchen. We didn't met our host but everything was emailed and no problem communicating this way as we got replies very quickly. Don't forget to print or keep the emailed instructions about how to access the house before you leave home. We would definitely recommend Blossom and Bloom as a place to stay in Bruges. We stayed for 3 nights and could have stayed longer.

No welcome when you came in. We were early,  we asked when we were able to get into our rooms, were told 3 PM. Came back, had to wait 20 minutes to be seen. No welcome. Then told that only one room was available and that the other employee was "stupid" to have told us otherwise.  Parking situation was also not explained although it is worth code and away from thehotel. My bathroom smelled funny. On the third night , after it got hotter outside I had to hold my breath to go in there. Smelled like sulphur. It was better in the morning,  but when I asked for a different room, they simply denied that there was a smell although a young woman who went with me to my room initially said she had smelled it before and could smell it now. While we were at breakfast they sent in someone else and then called to tell me that there was no smell. We left two days earlier than planned as I didn't want to inhale whatever it was for two more nights. There are also an untold number of awkward stairs in the hotel which my elderly mother struggled with. I would not recommend this place to anybody.,

Breakfast was good an the breakfast staff was very nice

My bus got to bruges way to early (5am) and i went straight to the hostel, immediately i got there i saw the sight saying that the property is locked until 6 am so i decided to wait. It is necessary to mention that it was really cold and it was raining a little bit, maybe for people from Bruges that the normal weather but for me it was really cold. Someone came like 5 min before 6 and i explained the situation and i asked her if there was any place i could stay before checking in to protect from the rain, she just answer..."there is not place for you to stay until 8 am"!!! I was completely mad because i never asked for a room or something like that!! I was just looking for somewhere not to get wet!! I asked her if i could leave my luggage and fortunately she said "yes, the looker room is downstairs" at least i didmt have to carry my bags to the bus station for 30 min again.,

After all my issue i had a good stay, the other people in the lobby were really friendly, the place its super nice and clean! The breakfast was really good even if it was just cereals and bread.

It would have been nice to have had a double bed rather than two single beds pushed together. It would also be good if there was a proper oven at the property rather than a portable oven which did work adequately but not sure if we would want to cook a roast dinner in it plus the manual isn't  in English which made it tricky. There are also several flights of stairs at the property which would potentially be tricky for less mobile individuals.,

The location of the property is excellent as it is a few minutes walk from the centre of Bruges and as it is down a side street the noise is minimal. The property has a garage which is ideal if you are travelling by car; we have an Audi a4 and it was big enough to accomodate this. The property is very spacious and there was plenty of room for the two of us! All of the rooms were of a good clean size and it was very handy having a kitchen which meant we didn't have to eat out. The property is warm as we travelled in December to the Christmas market so we had to use the central heating. Nadia met us at the property on arrival and her local knowledge was helpful. We would definitely stay here again without a doubt.

The hotel staff were extremely dirty. I went there with my family for xmas holiday. my daughter dropped her hairband on the toilet floor so I put it in the bin in toilet. when came back to my room after cleaner cleaned it, I saw she put the hair band next to the tap on the sink in bathroom so I put it back it the toilet bin and of course lots of dirty toilet roll after wiping ourselves was added inside the bin on top of the hairband. the day after when I came back I noticed the hairband is on my cloths in the room!!!!!! how dirty, untrained with no logic and incompetent can someone be??
I worn disposable gloves and took the hair band to talk to a manager. Shocking. even though the so called manager heard me and obviously couldn't be bothered and even though she saw me wearing disposable gloves to hold the dirty hairband, she just took it from my hand and put it on her desk. so I mentioned to her that now her desk has contaminated but didn't look like she cared. Food was very bad. my partner got sick after eating the burger in the restaurant. I advice anyone reading this to avoid this hotel at any cost.

Only negatives I can think of is that the stairs were quite steep leading to the apartment, so if you have trouble with mobility be wary of that. A bit out of town but didn't bother us, you could walk to the centre in 25/30 mins. Last minor thing is that the curtains need to be thicker in one room as the sun lit the whole place up, some people like waking up with the sun but after many beers its not ideal!!  I'm nit-picking of course,

The apartment was fantasic. Great open plan living area with comfortable sitting space, dining table leading to a great kitchen that opened up onto a spacious balcony, great to sit and have a tasty Belgium beer that Martijn so kindly left for us. Bedrooms were extremely comfortable, as was the bathroom, with literally the biggest single shower I have ever used (and it was powerful)! Martijn was a great host, very friendly when meeting us and he has made a little tourist book with helpful tips (best bars in Ghent the number one of importance). He's done a great job!!! Taxi only 8.50 euros in the day and 11 at night to get straight into the centre of town. A really great place to stay!

Upon arrival at the room after check-in, the air conditioning did not work, the wifi either and the small existing refrigerator did not either. I mentioned it to the reception but they could not give any solution, I had to use a personal network cable to connect to a wall socket and thus be able to have internet. Towards an unbearable heat and with the air conditioning not working could not be in the room, for which I had to open the balcony doors throughout the night, resulting in the entry of mosquitoes that "fried" me to bites all the night. I do not find it acceptable, that having booked a suite, upon arrival there will not work main services such as air conditioning and wifi. These things should be checked before offering the room in web portals. The direction of the hotel the first night remained totally passive, and did not react until the next day. To my understanding too late. Any excuse then does not solve anything.,

Friendly staff, but not too resolutive facing incidents. The existing restaurant has a varied menu of elaborate dishes. Existence of a park in the facilities, although yes, to get to it has to go through a door and a fairly narrow corridor, be careful with it.

We booked the double room with spa bath specifically because of the spa bath. We went above budget for this specific luxury. However when I was about to enjoy this spa bath, the lightning as well as the different functions weren’t working properly. Then when I used the double function, a lot of dirt came out of the tiny holes and all of a sudden I sat between what looked like pieces of old dirt. We asked the staff to come have a look and they did, but the language barrier made it impossible to work it out, so no spa bath luxury that we looked so much forward to. Afterwards the bath came ‘alive’ (accompanied with an awful smell and a lot of noice) on it’s own twice (!) ones in the middle of the night and ones in the morning. Would’ve of liked to see this differently obviously. Slightly dissapointed as you may understand. ,

The staff is very friendly, the hotel is modern and very very clean (this was a big big plus overall except for the spa bath!). Looks brand new even though I think isn’t. Really liked the big bed and room. Location is also a plus! Good wifi connection.

I did a booking and choose a single room with twin bed, as you can prove and shows in my booking confirmation, for my surprise the hotel gave me a terrible room, with a really small single bed (I even took pictures, was ridiculous!), in which I could not move for not to fall, it has been a scam, I have claimed the hotel and they have not cared in the least. If a claim were possible through you I would appreciate it, because I feel you have been robbed, what booking.com offered me and for what I paid was not what I received,

location was good, but I did a booking and choose a single room with twin bed, as you can prove and shows in my booking confirmation, for my surprise the hotel gave me a terrible room, with a really small single bed (I even took pictures, was ridiculous!), in which I could not move for not to fall, it has been a scam, I have claimed the hotel and they have not cared in the least. If a claim were possible through you I would appreciate it, because I feel you have been robbed, what booking.com offered me and for what I paid was not what I received

In the room - only the synthetic curtain in the bathtub - if it gets damp, it is a bit unpleasant. 
I did not understand the system of guarantee and did not have a credit card, but fortunatelly, I did not have to provide one in the end (until now, I don't understand what I was asked for and why).,

I stayed in Bloom several times 10 years ago in 2009 and I was delighted to return and find that everything was more or less the same in 2020. I liked unique decoration in each room, it is certainly refreshing to find such concept. The rooms are reasonably large, have everything one needs especially for short stays (tea, coffee etc.), and the breakfast is great. And I felt that the price has actually dropped in comparison with the high rates I was used to from the past. Close to the metro station (Jardin) Botanique. I loved it back then and still like it.
(I did not find the rooms in particular "need of renovation", they were just fine and good value. I am actually a bit sad that the artistic decorations may be gone fafter the planned rennovation this summer and the place would become more ordinary.)

We booked in at 3.15pm and at 4pm I reported that hardly any of the lights in our room were working (just the one by the door) which was very inconvenient. I was told that both the maintenance man and the hotel manager had already left for the day (which seems crazy when people book in after 3pm!). The reception guy (who had a definite air of acting like he was better than everyone else) said he’d report it to be fixed the next day. Apparently there were no other rooms available for us to move to. He said he’d change the bulbs that afternoon. 
It was not fixed that day, nor the next. There was no apology and he clearly didn’t care. It was my 50th birthday trip and this spoilt it for me. There was no attempt to compensate for the disappointment.
We also couldn’t open/close one of the curtains (it was stuck half way) so I slept very badly as the light came in in the morning.
There was also a LOT of noise from other guests.
The room was tired and tatty.
I would not stay here again.,

The location is great - close to the station and very close to the Grand Place

This was a very awkward experience! We only had SMS contact with the host. She did not respond to numerous calls and SMS messages when we were waiting for about half an hour in front of the door to be let in. In the end we sneaked into the building – following the cleaning lady? -  and found the front door of the apartment wide open. We found the keys to the apartment on the dining table with some instructions on a piece of paper. At that point we got an SMS with the code to the front door at street level to let us in – about half an hour after check-in time.
It was cold (18 degrees) in the apartment but we could not get the heating to work. Although the thermostat was a simple device we got instructions – via SMS – on how to operate the thing. This text-conversation lasted about 2 hours and meanwhile we decided to look for warmth in de city while trying to get help from the host. She then committed to put two small heaters in the living room. These were barely sufficient to increase the temperature by 1 degree after 2 hours. A very cold experience and we will never go back.,

The interior of the apartment was spacious although without a soul.

There was no wifi in our room and no cell service either, which wasn't terrible since we were trying to get away from it all anyway!  It would have been nice to have coffee or tea in our room as it gets dark early and nothing is open due to COVID so we spend more time in the room than we normally would have.,

The room was large and nicely appointed - a small sitting area, a small table and chairs where we had our meals (which were delivered to our room), a very comfortable bed (and comfy pillows, which is a first for our travels in Europe!) and a large shower and separate toilet.  We booked the suite and it had a large sliding glass door that opened onto a small deck (it was too cold so we didn't sit outside).    The grounds were lovely, even in winter.  There was a path that led from the property and went around the lake, and there were secluded areas on the property where you could sit and take a meal or just relax.  The host and her family were very friendly and our dinner and breakfast were wonderful!  She didn't speak English and I only speak a little French but we figured everything out just fine!

Room was poorly maintained with some electrical wiring terminated using tape and left hanging, carpet had seen better days and it appeared one of those days involved significant fluid loss.  The furniture in the room and around the hotel was great and i would applaud loudly if i felt they were really going for a shabby chic look, the shabby unfortunately only a side effect of poor maintenance and upkeep.  Bathroom was in good order but had been decorated as if in a holiday inn express not an old country house, disappointing.,

Greeted quite grumpily on arrival, i almost felt i should apologize for having disturbed them.  Location is great, the building is fantastic but unfortunately not well maintained or cleaned.  Staff were very helpful when cornered, otherwise they were more than happy to ignore us.  Restaurant and bar only open about 50% of the time, both closed the day we were there.  The room we had was very spacious with comfortable beds and linen, bathroom was relatively newly refurbished, but not in sync with the aesthetic of the rest of the building.  Staff did speak English which was helpful and we were directed to nearby Brasserie Dampierre for dinner which was pleasant but expensive.  The Hotel building and grounds deserved so much more than was on offer.

The hotel lacks soul and the rooms and decor  are tired looking and outdated. Tile floors in the rooms make it cold and unpleasant. In fact, heating was off and the room freezing when we arrived, which definitely doesn't make for a welcoming feel. And about feeling welcome, there's a warning at every wall or in the lifts or at breakfast: hospitality does not in any way seem to be on the owners' /managers' minds at all. Towels are washed out grey or yellow, rather than white. The mattress felt like cardboard and foam blocks serve as pillows, preventing a good night's sleep. Breakfast was meagre with low quality cold cuts and cheese, old bread and a lady (owner?) shouting after you where stuff is, therefore not allowing for a quiet, relaxing breakfast (it's not included anyway, so you're better off going somewhere nice). Having travelled a lot, we had a laugh with how bad the hotel was and we only stayed 1 night, so it was doable. But it baffled us how a place like this can have 3 stars. ,

The hotel being situated on the river side, close to the cute old town really is it's only good point.

Since our room was in the last building, the internet connection there was bad. Nearly useless. But the coverage in the lobby and other places were decent, however, speed was not great.,

Best Hostel I've ever been to so far. The cleanest, most comfortable and relaxed hostel I've ever been to. Our room was very big with just 4 beds. Other hostels put at least 12 beds in the same room. They cleaned rooms, corridors and everything, every day. The place even smelled good. The lockers in the room were so big, you could fit a human inside. With 3 shelves, 3-meter height, there is nothing you can't fit in. The locker room for storing your bags and suitcases after checking out was also free. No need for padlocks as all lockers has digital lock. Staff were super friendly, fluent in English and so helpful. Good breakfast included with cereals, cheese, bread, peanut butter, chocolate, milk, coffee, juice and oranges and apples. Very big kitchen with lots of kitchen appliances, 3 stoves and spices. The atmosphere in the bar/common area was so good. Every night live music. This is a place I will definitely go back to.

The rooms only had one mirror in the bathroom, no full length, I was traveling with my adult daughter so this made it more difficult to get ready.  The other problem was there was no good place for our suitcases. We ended up using the desk chair and the desk because the shelf was to thin to hold a suitcase. I could only put my suitcase on the desk sideways. I think installing a full length mirror and at least one folding luggage rack would be a very inexpensive improvement. There is no air conditioning that we could control so we had the windows open. But it wasn’t very hot so that was ok. I’m not sure if there is any type of air conditioning, so I’d check that out if you are staying during summer months.,

Very nicely decorated, extremely clean and you could easily walk to places. We did not purchase the breakfast but we did eat in one Italian restaurant around the corner that was good. The internet was in our room was strong. The shower was fantastic and it was one of the few rooms I’ve stayed in in Europe that knows how to put a door and a lip on the floor to prevent water from leaking!

I don't have any adverse comments. The Hotel is at Budget level, but everyone was helpful and pleasant, and the room was good value for that area.,

New Matinal is in the central square of La Louviere, and adjacent to the underground car park and other amenities. The Hotel has been refurnished, and the rooms are themed and well appointed, but small. They have paid attention to sound insulation, and the only noise after hours is a buzz from the bar downstairs. The shower room is basic, with a small 'timed' shower cubicle but it is modern. The bed was comfortable with power available by the bedside. There is no air-conditioning. Breakfast is in the bar on the ground floor and is a good selection of local bakery, good fruit juices, fruit, and fresh good coffee from an espresso machine! Entry to the hotel is by key-card and is secure. There is no lift. Our room had opening windows which provided fresh air and no noise. This part of Belgium is very French, and English is not spoken everywhere. There is a good selection of restaurants in the town; Chinese, Greek, Brazilian, (see photo), Italian, Pizza, and 'local'.

We were supposed to pay upon arrival, but were charged the full amount a week before we arrived - not a pre-auth, an actual charge. We contacted Booking.com about this and were told they payment details listed for ATW apartments were incorrect and would be changed. The hosts spoke no English and we had to attempt to communicate in what little French we knew, which was a bit tricky. The apartments are located next to a strip club, so it can be quite noisy. There is a bit of a mosquito problem, which meant we got really badly bitten on our first night and had to close all the windows for the remainder of our stay, which made it very hot. Not everything that is listed is included and it sounded like a family of elephants were staying above us, as we could hear them stomping around constantly.,

Good sized apartment that is centrally located. The lady that checked us in was very friendly - she made sure we had everything we needed and even went as far as to show us how the TV worked and go to get fresh batteries when she realised the ones in the remote were dead. Check out is very easy, you just leave your key in a box and go.

Most of the staff (reception, lobby bar, doorman/bellman, pool staff) were not friendly at all, not smiling. In the morning of August 23, we were passing by the lobby bar and we (!) greeted the waiter who was picking up candles from tables. He responded back without even turning his face to us. 2 bellmen were not smiling, as well as the pool guard. At 21:58 I asked him when the pool is open till tomorrow, he responded: “We close at 10 pm” (I spoke Russian, it’s my mother’s tongue) and looked very serious and sort of impatient. I got an impression he wanted me out of the pool ASAP. There were a few staff members who were friendly, but overall my family and I were shocked by the service... At the time of check in I paid with my credit card and I was not even offered to leave a deposit. I had to come back next day and do it just in case... Your service is not up to the world’s standard. Too bad!,

The room was very comfortable, clean and spacious. Room service was efficient. I really liked your spa facilities.

The families room 303 loo washroom / shower was a bit too cramped.
Could have done with a room fan for the hot sticky night, should have asked really,  my mistake.
Would have liked to have been able to book in earlier than 16:00 hrs, however booking out is 11:00 hrs.,

The room it's self was clean and tidy with little to no out side noise heard. There's  kitchen extractor flume close to the window... We had the room window wide open all night, with no problem or kitchen smells.
Being the upper / top floor it's was lovely and  quiet, we didn't really hear any other guests on our floor or using the lift. Rooms dosnt really have a view of the towns square as it rear facing... 
A cracking guesthouse / hotel which is located within the main square. 
The breakfast was amazing with an excellent selection of breakfast items. This is a continental  breakfast with ample fresh fruit,  meats, cheese, salmon, jams, spreads, 3 different types of fresh bread rolls as much tea, coffee, orange juice and water to drown yourself in, with the benefit of cooking your own boiled eggs also the opportunity to have fresh scrambled egg and bacon.

The bathrooms are very nice, but the design of the shower is poor.  Although very clean and spacious, the water leaks out.  The towel mat on the floor would be soaked with water.  Not a reason to not stay here, but just some feedback.,

The location was great.  Only a 10 minute walk to the train station, which was nice, as we visited many other areas throughout our stay.  Easy to find with free map you can get at train station ticket area, as it is a hotel actually listed on the map.   Also, the neighborhood was nice - felt safe walking back at night.
A bank to get cash was a short walk away, too.  It is decent walk to city center, but there is a tram.  We enjoyed the walk, so not an issue for us.  The room was spacious and very clean.  Loved the fact that you can open the window, especially after a shower to let out the steam and get some fresh air.  Train nearby was NOT an issue.   Very quiet.  Lovely grounds.  Hotel is being renovated, but not an issue.  Management did a great job working this. Would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

(These things were very minor and didn't affect our stay at all, I read some of the bad reviews here and luckily we didn't experience anything near that bad. Maybe we were just lucky?)
We drove here using a van and could not get a parking spot in the hotel, the van was too big. However, this was easily solved as there are many public parking spots around.
Tea and coffee are only provided in the lobby and not in the room. You have to buy tea and coffee yourself if you want to have it in your room (or go down the lobby to get it and go back up to your room again).,

The staff were super friendly and very helpful! For 6 people, we booked a studio apartment (1 bed & 1 sofa-bed) and a standard room (1 bed) but upon checking in to the hotel they gave us 3 standard rooms instead! We were lucky there was an empty standard room and the staff was really kind to have offered us the room. We didn't book the room with breakfast but we were able to cook in the room and made our own breakfast easily, the kitchen has everything you need.

Our 2 night stay in Brussels turned out pretty catastrophic:( We arrived quite late and were given a room - with no working heating, and it was below zero outside, so room temperature must have been around 10 degrees or below... We weanted to change the room but were told that the hostel os overbooked. Next morning, frozen as hell we tried to change the room which turned into a joke. First room we were given was cold w/o heating, next one had ppl in it etc... Ths staff was pretty friendly but adamant about no refunds... I tried to argue that there should be a refund if they fail to deliver a basic service... In the end after like 1-2 hrs of hustling we were finally given a room with heating on. There was no heating in the shared bathroom though and the room was sloppily cleaned, but at that point we did not care... Bruegel was far from cheap a price close to a hotel without basic service top back it up. So worst stay ever unfortunately.... I never thought this can happen in an European capital - hostel without heating at winter time....,

The location is really good, close to all sights and next to a nice church.

Everything was perfect.... ,

The apartment was beautiful with nice taste in decoration. Specially the live flowers that I loved to water every afternoon. 
The kitchen fasilaties were perfect and we cook many times and for many people...
The space was grate, and the beds were very comfortable. We had the best sleep in all our stay.
The owner gave us an extra key and a free parking space, and together with all the tips for, locations and places to visit and where to buy breakfast or supermarkets and bakery shops etc, I think she is a super host...
The wifi code is the smarter code we have ever seen and we all noted this. 
In general, 
Beautiful apartment with a nice touch and a quiet neighborhood. Easy to find and not far from the center. 10-15 minute walk and you can have a look in many historical monuments and many sightseeing...
The parking is easy to find, safe and with very small cost per day. (6€-24hours)... since we had a 2nd car that did not fit in the free parking space miss Sabine gave us
Gent is a destination everyone must check out, and 1,2,trois...Le Roi apartment is the place to stay.....
Excellent.....

Be prepared for the 2 flights of  narrow steep curved stairs to the apartment. The breakfast is, as expected, a "do it yourself continental" type but without cold meats or cheese. (Milk  sachets, orange juice, nespresso coffee, (a few) tea bags, white bread , jam, water, cans of coke, butter, 2 large bags of crisps and a tray containing assorted chocolates, cakes, sweet & savoury biscuits is provided).,

The apartment is spacious, modern inside, well lit, very comfortable, beautifully furnished and equipped. The quality of towels,bedding etc is high. BBC1 and 2 are available on the TV as well as assorted other channels. WiFi signal is strong. Nadia was very VERY helpful about collection of the keys and our arrival plans. The location is ideal for the Expo centre, Atomium and Mini Europe attraction nearby. To reach the centre of the city use  the Metro or Tram system both of which are easily reached from the apartment.  There are 2 large supermarkets a 10  minute walk away, plus a fruit/veg/ small supermarket a  5 minutes walk away. We enjoyed a meal in the very good Italian restaurant just around the corner.

There are no toiletries in the room, which is expected of a 4 star hotel. A sign in the bathroom welcomes guests to take a stroll to the reception (not that close in this colossal hotel) and to inspire them with toiletry requests. However, when we asked at the reception for a bar of soap, the receptionist searched for a minute and found out there wasn't any. He came back with conditioner...
There is a minibar in the room, but it's empty. Here too a sign that encourages us to inspire them...
The quality of the food in Restaurant Argan is disappointing and overpriced. A glass of wine for €9 but nothing special. These are prices of a high end hotel in Amsterdam.
At the bar time has stood still. While the entire hotel's design is unwelcoming, the bar looks like East Germany during communism.
I am a tall person, just under 2 meters. The ceiling in the wing where our room was located, was just over 2 meters, so my hear was scratching the plaster.
The price of breakfast was the most shocking: €38,

The location of the hotel is excellent, in the middle of the Zoniën forest.

There are two rooms with each a kingsize bed in it, we were appointed the one next to the bathroom which seemed very nice up until we tried to sleep in it. The sheets felt like they were coated with plastic, the matress was very hard but managed to form a deep hole after 10 minutes and the pillows fell flat immediately. We wondered why they gave us the uncomfortable bed, whereas the other bed felt very comfortable with nice sheets and good pillows, but after closing the windows for a while we found out it was because of the horrible sewer smell.
The bedroom was connected to the staircase of the owners with a wooden door and was above some kind of bar/livingroom where the owners were entertaing some guest till 1am and were running up and down the stairs which made it even harder to sleep.
The room didn't seem very clean. We found an open can in the fridge and clothes in the drawers.
The television didn't work. 
Curtains in the bathroom would have been nice.,

The location was very nice. With better weather the swimming pool would have been very nice. Hiking paths pass right next to the house. It's pretty spacious although not very functional.

The check-in and check-out times are really not convenient especially if you are travelling to Bruges just for the week-end which is enough to explore and discover this small yet beautiful city. 
I would have appreciate a later check-out (12 or 1 pm) as it was raining all-day long during our time (first week-end of July).  My sister whom I was travelling with was pregnant and she would have needed to rest a little bit. 
The host told me that we couldn't check-out later because of the cleaning lady hours. She had 5:30 hours to clean a bedroom and a bathroom ! I think that should be reviewed in order for guest to fully enjoy theirs bookings. 
A dirty towel was left in the bathroom and the bed lamps were not cleaned at all inside, full of dust !,

The rooms are very well decorated with taste. Bathroom is super nice and big with a window overlooking a quiet courtyard. The view from the room is really nice. The room is well located thos you need a little more than 5 minutes to reach the city centre. It is about 10 minutes to 15 if you discover Bruges for the first time and that you will probably stop at times :)

In cold weather, we had to wait outside for at least 40 mins to get the key! At the beginning, the lady even asked us to wait for more than 1 hour! 
In the hall smelled always smoking...
The door was very difficult to open with the key...it took a couple of mins to open.
The cleaner who open the door had a cold face and does speak any English. 
All the beds are super small, we could not sleep well!
Charged 20 euros per day for a little baby but did not provide any service... （normal hotels offer free bed for children under 3 years）.
In the small room, the cabinet smells very bad because of the poor furniture quality... one of the curtains was broken.
Thanks for this experience, I would always just select a hotel in the future!,
